original_solution_mapping.L1: If 10 half-gallons of milk bake 40 cookies, then one half-gallon of milk bakes 40/10 = 4 cookies.
original_solution_mapping.L2: If one half-gallon of milk bakes 4 cookies. to bake 200 cookies, you'll need 200/4 = <<200/4=50>>50 half-gallons of milk

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 4943.
    Returns: the number of half-gallons of milk needed to bake the specified number of cookies.
    """
    # L1
    initial_cookies = 40 # bake 40 cookies
    milk_for_initial_cookies = 10 # 10 half-gallons of milk
    cookies_per_half_gallon = initial_cookies / milk_for_initial_cookies

    # L2
    target_cookies = 200 # bake 200 cookies
    half_gallons_needed = target_cookies / cookies_per_half_gallon

    # FA
    answer = half_gallons_needed
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: If {milk_for_initial_cookies} half-gallons of milk bake {initial_cookies} cookies, then one half-gallon of milk bakes {initial_cookies}/{milk_for_initial_cookies} = {cookies_per_half_gallon} cookies.

If one half-gallon of milk bakes {cookies_per_half_gallon} cookies. to bake {target_cookies} cookies, you'll need {target_cookies}/{cookies_per_half_gallon} = <<{target_cookies}/{cookies_per_half_gallon}={half_gallons_needed}>>{half_gallons_needed} half-gallons of milk

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L1: If 40 half-gallons of milk bake 40 cookies, then one half-gallon of milk bakes 40/40 = 1 cookies.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: If one half-gallon of milk bakes 1 cookies. to bake 200 cookies, you'll need 200/1 = <<200/1=200>>200 half-gallons of milk

explanation: Input misrepresentation. The value for 'initial_cookies' (40) was used instead of 'milk_for_initial_cookies' (10).
